lines.text: Pay me one billion dollars, and I'll kill Superman!

[chuckles]
What makes you think you can kill Superman when you can't even handle a mere mortal in a Halloween costume?

[seizes Luthor by his jacket]
There's nothing mere about that mortal!
[Superman uses x-ray vision to see that Batman is really Bruce Wayne]
Bruce Wayne!
You peeked.
How could you have lied to me like that?
Now I never actually said I wasn't Batman.
[Joker's plane crashes into the sea and explodes]
Puddin'!
At this point, he probably is.
Where's the Joker?
Who knows? Makin' ha-ha with Harley Quinn.
[to Bruce Wayne, on dating Lois Lane]
My, you do live dangerously. Don't you realize you're moving in on Superman's main squeeze?
[Batman takes evidence and leaves]
Hey, he can't leave a crime scene with evidence.
You want to stop him? Be my guest!
Let's make an example of this hero.
[shoves Lois into a seat, buckles her seat belt and pulls it tight]
A very tragic example, I'm afraid, Miss...?
Lane.
Lane? Lois Lane? The one Superman always saves?
'Fraid so.
[Harley's driving Lex Luthor's limo]
Whoa, momma, check out the cute hitchhiker!

[hitchhiking and showing off his gams]
Yoo-hoo!
[after realizing Batman has discovered his identity]
Touché.
[Superman has just broken in on the Joker]
More powerful than a locomotive... and just about as subtle.

[grabs Joker]
You maniac! You idiot! How dare you use one of my laboratories for your...?
Harley?
[Harley somersaults out and strikes a ridiculous fighting stance]
Put him down, baldy!
Mercy?
[Mercy slams a flying kick into Harley]
Here's for that punch in the face!

[to Luthor]
Can't we discuss this like gentlemen?
[Luthor reluctantly releases Joker, while sounds of fighting continue in the background]
Ooh, listen to Little Miss Can't-Take-A-Joke!
[as Joker guides Luthor to a chair, Mercy goes flying across the room]
Thank you. Have a seat, please.
[as they sit, Harley charges across the room]
BANZAI!

[rubbing the seat in Lex Luthor's limo]
Ooo, rich Corinthian Leather!
Any sign of the comedian?
Three nights, and not so much as a green hair.
Of course, you have been dividing your time between work and Lois.
Is that a problem?
Let's just say I'm concerned. Your reputation is... dubious. In and out of costume.
Don't worry. I'm taking Lois quite seriously. Besides, it seems to me you had your chance.
The office, now.
Swell, Mr. L.
Mr. L?
I sense we are kindred spirits, you and I. Oh, there are differences, to be sure... like hair.
[Chuckles and pat's Luthor's bald head]
[to Clark Kent, about Bruce Wayne]
I hear he's nothing but Gotham trash. Rich, spoiled...
[sees Bruce Wayne disembarking from his jet]
... and absolutely gorgeous!
[Batman holds up a small sliver of Kryptonite to Superman, who buckles]
It doesn't take much, does it?
Oh, this could be a fair fight after all! And who wants to see that?
[Batman and Lois Lane are pursued by a deadly robot]
How do I contact Superman?
He's out at sea!
Never around when you need him.
I'll get some iodine for that scrape. Burning, STINGING iodine.
It's ironic, you know. She likes Bruce Wayne and she likes Superman. It's the other two guys she's not crazy about.
Too bad we can't mix-and-match.
[Batman puts on his cowl, ready to leave. Lois Lane walks in]
Oh, no.
Has to be done.
I don't suppose a stern lecture on unnecessary risk-taking is going to sway you.
Sorry.
I didn't think so. Just be...
[Batman is gone]
... careful.
Luthor's been lining all his buildings with lead. Blocks my X-ray vision.
Well, there's always the direct approach.
[Superman smashes through the wall. Batman approves]
You're learning.
Ceasar Carlini, my old pal! Why I haven't seen you since... wait, I've never seen you, have I? You need to get out more.

[answers phone]
Hello?
Hi, it's me. I just wanted to let you know I'll be in late tomorrow morning. I'm having breakfast with Bruce.
Isn't that special.
Do I detect a note of disapproval?
You were the one who compared him to garbage.
Well, I was wrong. He's very thoughtful, romantic, and a lot deeper than the tabloids would have you believe.
[Clark looks closer at his cape and sees a miniature bat-shaped tracking device planted on it]
You'd be surprised.
Would I now?
[after the Batplane buzzes the Lexwing]
Batman! It's always Batman! What you got in the way of air-to-air missiles, Lex?
You're asking *me* for help?
If I go down, you go down.
It's a red switch.
Which red...? Oh, the heck with it!
[he jabs buttons at random]
[first lines]
Hang on there, Clyde!
Sorry, miss, we're closed.
Just look at what I'm selling! You'll plotz!
Um, Superman.
Yes?
I was just thinking... it might be nice to see each other when I wasn't falling out a window or something. Not that I'm not grateful for all the times you've helped me, you understand.
I understand.
You do?
[Lois, kicking herself for asking Superman on a date, talks to herself]
I understand, Lois. Really, you do? Yep, you're a complete moron. Why thank you, Superman, I think I'm a total loser, too. Jeez.
I don't like guns.
So just keep your ears open. Let me know if you hear any buzz about The Joker.
Sure thing, Mr. Kent. Eh, but, eh, which one? There's lots of jokers around here.
[Bruce Wayne topples over the edge of a skyscraper]
See that he's street pizza! In this town, some flying fool could have caught him!

[to The Joker]
You sick, demented, murdering freak!

[gasp]
How rude!
[Batman encourages a Kryptonite-dazed Superman]
Snap out of it, Kent, or Joker gets the last laugh.

[holding a gingerbread Batman cookie]
Hello, Mr. J. I'm Batman! Eat me! Eat me! Eat me!
[the Joker sees Batman fly towards him with a jetpack]
Copy-bat! Copy-bat! Suffering from propulsion envy, Batboy?
[Lois Lane discovers Bruce Wayne is Batman]
So when were you going to tell me? The honeymoon?
[Mercy is watching Harley Quinn, on TV, being tossed into a padded wagon in a straightjacket]
I want a lawyer! I want a doctor! I want a cheese sandwich!
Now that's funny! Ha, ha, ha!
[last lines]
[Bruce Wayne says good-bye to Clark Kent]
She's all yours now, if you can handle that. But you'd better be good to her... 'cause I know where you live.
Thanks. I couldn't have saved Lois without your help.
I'm aware of that.
Expect the unexpected.

[after Batman throws Superman across the room with a judo throw, Superman knocks him onto a table]
I heard you were crazy, but I didn't think you were stupid.
[as Luthor and Joker finish their discussion, Mercy and Harley are still pounding each other's heads on the floor]
Mercy, let's go!
[to Joker]
Keep in mind, this is your last chance.
[He walks out. Mercy limps after him, groaning. Harley limps over to Joker, also groaning]
How you doin', slugger?
A-okay, Mr. J!
[He pats her on the shoulder. She collapses]

You want to know what really galls me? Besides the fact that the new man in my life is really two men? It's that I'm sitting on the hottest story of the year - "Batman Unmasked!" - and there's not a blessed thing I can do about it!
Then you really do love me.
[Alfred opens a case, revealing a jet pack and a set of glider wings]
If I may be so bold, sir. When in Rome...

[typing at her desk]
"... the Senator declined comment." Done.
[Bruce appears and kisses her cheek]
And not a moment too soon.
Bruce! When did you...?
About three paragraphs ago. I didn't want to disturb you.
Hey, Clark, keep Bruce company for a minute while I see the Chief, okay?
Uh, Lois...
Shh, don't be intimidated. Regale him with stories of
[posh voice]
the nightlife in Smallville.

[as she's being wrapped in a straight jacket and being loaded into a police van]
I want a lawyer!, I want a doctor!, I want a cheese sandwich!

[to Lois]
I still wish you'd change your mind about Gotham.
I adore you Bruce, but now there's a lot about you I don't know and I'm not sure I want to know.
I understand.
Take care of yourself.
[kisses him on the cheek and leaves]
Look at all the toys! Santa's been to to you, Lex!
